title: General Procedure to Solve Inequalities
text: To solve an inequality, we must first gather all constants on one side and all variable terms on the other. Then, we can isolate the variable term.
speech: To solve an inequality, we must first gather all constants on one side and all variable terms on the other. Then, we can isolate the variable term.
pacedSpeech: To solve an inequality, we must first gather all constants on one side and all variable terms on the other. Then, we can isolate the variable term.

title: Isolating the Variable Term
text: We must divide both sides by $$7$$ to isolate s. $$s<-4$$
speech: We must divide both sides by , 7  to isolate s.  s, is less than negative 4

to isolate s.   s, is less than negative 4
